definition: duty/responsibility/post
office/duty
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice
to abscond/to be absent without leave
to neglect one's duties
(to be guilty of) dereliction of duty

sentences.english: Do not lure her away from her duty .
He stained his military record by going AWOL [a.w.o.l.=absent without official leave].
sentences.chinese: 他因擅离职守而玷污了军绩。

sentences.english: Are you doing it faithfully and in the best possible away?
sentences.chinese: 你有否尽忠职守，全心全意地把工作做好？

sentences.english: Leave work area without taking safe measure, cause company significant loss.
sentences.chinese: 擅离职守，致公司蒙受重大损失者。

sentences.english: Regulators dozing Homer Simpson-like at the switch?
sentences.chinese: 难道是监管者像荷马。辛普森那样玩忽职守？

sentences.english: causing losses to archives as a result of neglect of duty on the part of archivists.
sentences.chinese: 档案工作人员玩忽职守，造成档案损失的。

sentences.english: And fulfill their duties than the spirit of personal prestige is more important.
sentences.chinese: 恪尽职守的精神比个人的声望更重要。

sentences.english: He usually is a very loyal employee but occasionally he lies down on the job.
sentences.chinese: 他通常是一位很忠实的受雇者，但偶尔也会玩忽职守。

sentences.english: Nemesis, the goddess of measure and not of revenge, keeps watch.
sentences.chinese: 正义而非复仇女神尼弥米西斯，向来忠于职守。

sentences.english: The city man ager says the suits may claim negligence by the town and its employees.
sentences.chinese: 市领导称这起诉讼可能会判该镇及其职员玩忽职守罪。

sentences.english: Be away from duties without the of a superior officer.
sentences.chinese: 军人咱未获上级军嘿允许的情丽下擅离职守。

sentences.english: He was found guilty of gross dereliction of duty.
The United Nations lost some of its most dedicated staff on that day.
sentences.chinese: 那一天联合国失去了一些最尽忠职守的工作人员。

sentences.english: The official was dismissed for neglect of his duty.
sentences.chinese: 这名官员因玩忽职守而遭开除。

definition: to observe one's duty steadfastly/devoted to one's job
to abscond/to be absent without leave
to discharge one's duties/conscientious
to neglect/to trifle with/not to take seriously
to have custody of
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
diligence/diligent/industrious
appointment to an important post
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
to pursue public affairs
(of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
responsibility must lie where it belongs (idiom)
law and order/rules and discipline
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
devotion to duty
to neglect one's duty/dereliction of duty/malpractice
